text: Tap at U-Fleku, Prague. Deep black in the glass, huge head. Mild-malty aroma. Starts malty and dry, modest roasty, not too intense. Light smokey hints. Finish warming-malty, soft-malty, well balanced. Quite drinkable. Nice experience at this interesting place!

Pleasant aroma of caramel and bread. Small beige head disappearing to thin layer with great lacing. Dark brown colour. Great taste of roasted malts with well-balanced caramel sweetness. Appropriate carbonation makes it even more drinkable.

On tap, @U Fleků, Praga. Viaje 03/2017
Color negro corona de espuma beige, aromas torrefactos, sabor tostado con notas a cafe, cuerpo ligero, agradable de beber.
0.4L from tap at the brewery. Black lager, remarkably easy to drink and good flavour.

From tap at brewpub, pours opaque dark brown liquid, big frothy tan head, Aroma: dark roasted malts, chocolate, yeasty, subtle hernal hop aroma: Taste: medium sweet, light to medium bitter, slightly sour notes, light to medium sour, roasted malts, caramel, yeasty, slightly herbal hopy, Palate: medium body, average carbonation, slick mouthfeel, long caramel roasty aftertaste, Overall: very good, enjoyed.

Draught at brewhouse. What an experience it is to drink this beer at the brewhouse, only U Fleku dark loveliness being passed around, as good as has been written about. The beer is delicious and despite its dark apperance, quite refreshing and delicate.

Tap at the brewpub. Poured a clear dark brown with a frothy off white head. The aroma is roasty smoky malt, liquorice, charcoal. The flavour is moderate to light sweet with a light dry roasty sweet malty palate. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.
Keg at the brewery. Pours black, nose is chocolate, roasted, malty, taste is sweet, chocolate, light roasted malts, thin.
PET from brewery, Prague, CZ, Malt,caramel,coffee and chocolate aroma, Dark brown, huge lacing head, Sweeter taste, fair bitter ending, Medium body, Average carbon, Really tasty tmavy. Simply superb.

From tap at with Gunnars ryk & reis U Fleků 08.11.16. Ebony. Pale brown head. Aroma and taste of dark candy sugar, dark caramel, dark chocolate, dark malt, vanilla and a slight hint of roasted malt, Round mouthfeel, Excellent!
One of the greatest beers Ive ever drank, I would go back to Prague just to drink it again.
On tap at brewery. Dark chestnut color, tan head. Aroma of roasted malt. Taste is a little bit watery. Good one, but Tmavy from U tri ruzi is way better.

Draught at the brewpub. What an experience. Magnificent dark brown colour. Aroma of roasted sugar, coffee and chocolate. Taste starts with light sweet roasted malt. Its nutty and chocolaty, while finish is light bitter. Body is full with nice balance in carbonation. One of my Prague highlights.
Tested a while back. Rated from memory.

Tap at U Fleků, Prague: Very dark brown colored brew with an smoothly sweet bitter taste, hints of chocolate, coffee and some roastiness. Worth the walk and avoiding the tourist trap things, drunk 4 of them and this one is on my "legendy beers" list now.

Tap (U Fleku, Prague)
Black, tight tan head - a sight for sore eyes. Rich treacly roast aroma, sweetish. Rich roasty taste, gentle coffee in the roast, reminds me of Tallinns Beer House Dunkel - a perfect Cerne. Full smooth palate. Great drinkability.

(tap ~0,1l @ Festival minipivovarů na Praském hradě 2016)
Aroma: Roasted malt, licorice.
Appearance: Dark brown color. Medium, light brown head.
Taste: Medium sweet, caramel, light licorice.
Palate: Light bitter finish.
Overall: Good czech dark lager.

Tap (U Fleku, Prague). Very dark brown, almost black color. Medium size, thick and creamy tan head, stays. Roast, grainy, milky, coffee in aroma. Roast, sweet, grainy, coffee in taste. Delicate shy hops, tingly on tongue, in aftertaste. Excellent brew.

Siphon 2l. Tiefdunkel, Hefetrübung aufgrund dessen nicht erkennbar. Man erwartet wegen der Trübung Röstaromen aber stattdessen: Karamell und Toffee überall! Keine erkennbare Bittere, Hopfen kaum wahrnehmbar. Extrem süffig, jedoch ohne aufdringliche Süße. Unglaublich bei 13% Stammwürze! Perfektes Böhmisches Dunkel! Kann man nicht besser machen, ein Weltklassiker.

On tap U Fleku, they just brought it to lovely Anja and myself. Black with orange tint, tan head, diminishing. Malty, mostly caramel. Sweet, full taste. Roasty finish. Light, soft carbonated. Good stuff.
Draught at the restaurant. Nice lasting head. Dark color. Chocolate and roasted aroma. Smooth chocolate taste with balanced bitterness. Big drinkabillity.

#593Tap at the brewpub. Hazy rubbish to black body, medium off-white head. Aroma of low intensity: sourish, roasted malts. Taste is almost neutral, only slightly sour; slightly bitter aftertaste. Coffee, roasted malts. Medium to light body, moderately carbonated, smooth palate.Legendary beer from legendary brewpub, but my expectation was maybe too high. It´s only quite good.
Draught at the brewpub. Cloudy, brown colored. AROMA- roasted malts, touch of coffee. FLAVOR- neutral, slightly lactic sour, roasted malts. Medium bodied.Quite good.
From the tap @indewildeman. Black beer with a small head. Medium carbonation. Aroma of roasted malt, hop and liquorice. Same in the taste, full bodied for 4,5% abv.

On tap at the source. Pours dark and frothy into the glass with a thick creamy head and lots of lacing. Aroma is malty; taste is roasted dark malt and a hint of caramel. Medium bodied. Taste is rich and smooth, but the finish trends towards watery. Good pleasant drinking for a long session at U Fleku.
Tap @ U Fleku. Nice head with excellent duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are roast malt, chocolate, grass, straw and hops. Nice.
Celkový dojem z piva zveličilo prostredie pivovaru, jemný kávový podmaz, koda e ho dostať len 0,4l
UPDATED: MAR 12, 2016 This is a big, intense beer for the ABV. Thick, sticky, rounded,. Very fresh. Sweet with a hint of roast. Really dug this one.
Mörkt brun öl med ett mörkbeige skum. Doft av malt, karamell och lätt rostade toner. I smaken tillkommer lätta asktoner. Mindre söt än jag minns den.

Vom Fass im Brauhaus in Prag. Tief schwarze Farbe mit viel cremigem beigen Schaum der lange hält. Kaffee, Bitterschokolade und Toffee. Geschmack ist vollmundig bitter mit Süße im Abgang. Ein Klassiker!
Tap in Prag at the brewery.Black colour with large beige creamy head aroma is roasted with flavor of licorice and mild chocolate nice full body it is the right beer on the right place.

Entre las mejores de su estilo. Marrón oscura, turbia. Pequeña capa de espuma morena. Aroma malteado y a frutos secos. Sabor eminentemente malteado, con algo de chocolate y nueces. Cuerpo medio y paladar muy suave con gas contenido. Seco final.
On tap. Dark brown color with lacing and tanned head. Aroma is chocolate and some noble hops. Taste is chocolate and caramel. Medium body. Overall its great dark lager.

tap @ U Fleku, originally rated 2015-04-22
Dark orange, almost black beer with big and persistent beige head leaving lacing. Aroma has chocolate, dark bread, licorice and light coffee. Flavor has roasted malts, coffee, chocolate and mämmi. Palate is thin with quite strong carbonation. Finish has light bitterness. Aftertaste has coffee and roasted malts. Rich flavor but too thin for my taste.

Keg at the Brewpub in Prague Day 4 of Fergus and Sarahs Czech jaunt. 2/10/14. Opaque black / caramel borwn coloured pour with a steadfast cream coloured frothy head. Aroma is woody, earthy, toasted bread. Flavour is quite sweet, toast, malty nutty, bit too sweet, somewhat under fermented. Palate is semi-sweet, fullish, creamy, moderate carbonation.

So we heard about U Fleku as a beer destination, but I did not quite realize until we got in that its the Hofbrauhaus of Prague. Meaning, there are multiple rooms and they stick tourists in the huge "cabaret" stage area. We were going to order food but then they were out of things so we just decided to move on after beer. The beer was pretty nice though. I loved that they just have the one beer, and its Koln "kobe-style" - served off of big trays whenever youre ready. Atmosphere was fun, but would be better to go with locals to one of the other rooms (or be completely into it with a tourist group).

Cervesa molt correcte, bon aspecte i un bon gust, detaquen els torrats com la xocolata.
Cerveza muy correcta, buen aspecto y un buen sabor, destacan los tostados como el chocolate.

UPDATED: MAR 23, 2015 0,4L draught at U Fleku, Prague. Pitch black, off-white foamy head. Roasted malty with chocolate and milky coffee, sweet tones too, soft mouthfeel. Low carbonation, light body (lager).
I had this pint at the brewery U Fleků, in Prague. A nice dark lager in a historical setting.

From the tank at the brewery. Dark body with tan head. Aroma has caramel character, mapple syrup, toffee. Taste has dry caramel sweetness, light coffee, roast, ash in the after taste. Body is medium with pretty high carbonation for this style. Godo beer.
Najlepie čierne pivo aké som kedy pil, teda je fakt, e čierne moc nepijem, ale toto bolo super...
Kdy tu mám někoho z ciziny určitě ho ke Flekům na pivečko panáčka a pěknou atmosféru pozvu a za pivo se nemusím stydět. Dobrej tmavej leáček.
Color is dark brown with huge tan head. Aroma is chocolate and little coffee. medium carbonation, full bodied. taste is chocolate, roasted malt. after its short and sweet. very balanced beer.
UPDATED: DEC 14, 2014 Tap on the bar. Very beautiful dark color with a tanned head. Chocolate and sweet but not to much. Medium body. I like this stile very much and this one is probably my favorite

keg at the brewery 15/10/14
hazy, full bodied, roasty, digestive biscuit, dry, moderate carbonation, full flavoured. decent

UPDATED: FEB 1, 2015 Tap at the brewpub. Pours dark brown with a creamy tan head. Aroma is mostly chocolate. Not quite med body. Flavor is basically dark chocolate malt. Its pretty dry, but not entirely. Worth seeking out. Fairly easy access by the metro.
From tap @ the brewery. Pours dark brown with an off-white head that leaves some lacing. Aroma and flavour are roasted malt, nuts, and chocolate - with a slightly dry finish.
Drought at U Fleku, in 2013. Dark brown with a reddish tint with spongy beige head, roasty aroma,low carbonation, thin body, medium finish. Great atmosphere and nice place to taste it.
0,4l on Tap at U Fleku/Praha. Dunkles Bier mit heller, cremiger Schaumkrone. Riecht angenehm nach Röstmalzen. Schmeckt auch so, sehr gut abgestimmt und vor allem sehr süffig!
Korrekt, meglepően jó, én meg csak valami hatásvadász turistacsalogatónak hittem, de nagyon megérte kipróbálni. Persze azért volt itt ámítás e nélkül is.

Tasty beer, from a great place in Prague. They walk around with this in great glasses and put one on the table almost before you sit down. The score is kept with stripes on a piece of paper. The beer itself is quite good, notes of burned malt and caramel, with some mild spicing. Good.

Výčap U Fleku. Tmavá hnedá farba, krémová pena drala, aj keď pivo bolo divno čapované. Vôňa karamelová, praené sladý, jemne chmeľ. V chuti opäť praené slady, karamel, káva, stredné telo, suchá dochuť. Veľmi pitné.

Roasted malt nose and a luscious dark brown color crowned by a substantial head that lasts till the bottom of the glass. Big roasted malt taste with pronounced chocolate tones. Warm mouth feel and a long taste profile. Fantastic beer in a fantastic location

Draught at the brewpub. Hazy dark brown color with thick creamy tan-like head and great lacing. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, caramel and chocolate. Taste starts with light sweet roasted malt, nutty and chocolate notes, follows fresh grainy, while finish is light bitter. Medium to full body, slick texture and lively carbonation in palate. Certainly a must try...
Brilliant appearance of dark brown colour and dense beige creamy head; aroma and taste of roasted sugar, coffee and some bready notes - good tmavy

Draught
Aroma-caramel, coffee, chocolate, 
Appearance-black, hazy, tan foam, 
Taste-light sweetness, lightly sour, lightly bitter, very good balanced
Palate-medium body, oily feel, lively, sour finish
Overall-perfect

Draught at U Fleku, Prague, January 2014. Very dark brown with a hard beige head that leaves a pretty lace. Grainy, caramel aroma but all in all rather faint. Sweet, roasty and a little nutty taste. Smooth, medium-bodied, slightly roasty finish.

On tap in 2004 at the brewery. From notes. Pours a deep brown to black with small tan head. Aroma is of burn barley kernels and some caramel. Taste is not so thick and again having a very charred taste going with some mild sweetness and some marshmallow at the end. A very different beer than most of the area which is nice but not overall a great beer for my palette.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text: Poured black.with a frothy white head. Aroma of sweet malt. Medium body, flavour of dark chocolate, caramel malt, sweet finish. Nice if over-rated.

Keep ?em pourin! 0,4L mug @ U Flek?. Dark. Black color, dark tan foam. Bold lace. Smells of charred malts. Tastes has a chalky character. Flavor of grain bits still floating in the beer. Tastes so fresh! (3809)

UPDATED: AUG 22, 2013 0.4 l beer tap. Apperance: red-black, medium head, lots of lacing. Aroma: bread, toast, some chocolate. Flavour: biscuit, bread, caramel, chocolate. Balanced. Overall: good, but my opinion is that it is overrated.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2014 Old rating, tap @ the brewery/restaurant:
Sødmerik lukt med preg av mørk malt, humle, mørk sjokolade og litt lakris. Sødmerik smak med preg av mørkbrent malt, humle, mørk bitter sjokolade, litt kaffi og salt lakris. Middels bitterhet og lengde, litt brentpreg. God.

Draught.dark pour with creamy head.aroma coffee,roasted malt and chocolate.full body.taste of grain and coffee.had about six or seven of them.a great beer that you should try,at least once in your life.

UPDATED: DEC 2, 2015 Nera e delicatamente schiumosa; offre al naso sentori tostati, caffè, cacao e cereali, al palato compaiono più deboli note caramellate e luppolate ma mantiene un carattere "tosto e tostato" più intenso di altre dunkel  o schwarzebier. Cremosa e beverina, di corpo medio ed effervescenza debole è una birra molto interessante, abbinamento obbligatorio ed impeccabile durante il pasto nello storico locale di Praga!
Draught at U Fleku. Big, creamy head, dark brown colour. Aroma coffee, hops, a bit of caramel.. Taste is unforgettable, roasted, caramel and coffee. One of the best dunkel beers.

#54
 Was soll man von der Mutter aller Schwarzbiere schon großartig schreiben? Jeder, der schon mal in der wunderschönen Stadt Prag war, ist wohl auch im U Fleku gelandet. Ein wahrhaft bierseeliger Ort der Bier, Tradition und Lebensart ausstrahlt. Das Bier ist sehr dunkel und hat reichlich Schaum. Das Aroma ist primär malzig mit etwas Bitterschokolade. Der Antrunk ist toll süffig, weil alles andere als schwer und süß geraten, Meisterklasse! Ein geradezu erfrischendes Schwarzes mit tollem Nachgeschmack nach Toffee und verhaltenem Röstmalz. Mit dem nächsten Bämbel geht das Geschmackserlebnis vom neuen los. Dazu noch das leckere Essen verbunden mit dem Tuba- u. Akkordeonduo mit "Viva Colognia" und der Bierhimmel ist so nah!
Tolles Brauhaus, tolles Bier!
Prag ist immer eine Reise wert!
	
Test vom 20.9.2009, Gebinde: Fass 	Noten: 14,12,13,13,-,13 - 12,94


				
Jevers Zeuge meint:

Draught at U Fleku, Prague. Almost black with a big, creamy head. Medium strong aroma of coffee, yeast and grain. Light sweetish with a medium bitterness. Full body. Strong flavour of grain and coffee, with notes of chocolate and light roast. A deliciously sessionable dunkel that fits in perfectly with the brewpub it is made in.

Tap at the brepub. Big stable brown head. Darkbrown, almost black colour. Aroma coffee, roasted, quite tempting. Light caramel. Taste is very lightly watery, harmonic caramel-roasted, very light coffee. Greatly drinkable.

Keg at U Fleku. I drank several of these alongside a hefty Pork Knuckle. Pours Dark Brown/Black with a creamy off-white head. Aroma is of dark malts. Flavour has Coffee, Chocolate, caramel. The texture is velvety and comes across almost like Best or Guiness. Better though. Very nice.

Draught.
Pours a dark brown, with a beige head.
Roasted, malty aroma, chocolate, diacetyl, caramel, coffee, hops.
Off-dry, medium body and bitterness, creamy CO2.
Malty taste, roasted, chocolate, coffee, caramel, toffee, hops, diacetyl, light smoke.
Smooth, velvety, balanced. (2012-09-11)

Dark pour with a huge head.  I drank 3 of these with dinner at the famous U Fleků brewery in Prague.  Aroma of grain, a little roast and a very light mouth.  Nothing crazy special, but also a very tasty easy drinker.

Draught @ the brewpub. Rated on 14.07.2010
Aroma is rather malty with roasted notes and coffee. Flavour is slightly sweet with lots of roasted malt, some coffee, salmiac and herbs. I like the salmiac notes here.

On draught at the worlds oldest brewpub, of course.  What this beer is not is a classical example of a style of beer that has been forgotten, or one of the finest tasting beers in the world.  What it is can be summarised as being perfect for its place.  Brewed by the same person for 40 years in the same place, gently developed in response to getting better kit and better ingredients.  Always intending to be its own beer.  Dark, light and comforting with a puff of coal dust for edge.  (Not literally!)
On tap in beer hall in Prague. Pours a dark brown with an off white head and chocolate aroma. Taste is toasty and sweet, of chocolate, roasted malt, and caramel. Nice beer to enjoy while in Prague.

On tap at the beer hall in Praque. Nice dark chocolate appearance with
a nice head. Smell is malty with hints of chocolate. The Dunkel had a
nice taste of coffee, malt and chocolate. Rather light but drinks well. In these parts it was a blessing. Drinkable.

Tap @ brewery in Prague. Deep brown appearance with a nice foamy light brown head. Mild roasty, chocolate, light coffee, a bit nutty aroma. Very smooth, a bit fruity, toasty malty, light caramel, straw, mild chocolate flavor. Easy to drink. I sat and drank three liters of this mofo with no problem. Good shit.

(on tap) Dark brown, almost black, opaque with a brown head. Aroma: coffee, plenty of it! And very roasted, obviously. Creamy mouthfeel. Medium sweet taste, but not in a bad way - apparently the sweetness works well with the roasted coffee aroma - and luckily not sticky. Difficult to focus on the beer though, when you need to drink it among drunk and smoking tourists at the U Fleků brewpub.

Draught at the brewery, way back in 2001 I believe, when I visited Prague with school. Remember it was very dark brown colored with a big beige head. Moderate to heavy malty, a bit roastyness, slighty some hops. Soft but suitable mouthfeel.

UPDATED: JUN 16, 2016 Tap at U Fleku brewpub. Hazy dark brown color with large beige long lasting head. Aroma of roasted malt, caramel, toffee. Taste, roasted malt, toffee, coffee, milk chocolate, citrus hops. Bittersweet finish. Good. From notes: 3/2012.

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2013 On tap at U Fleku. Really dark with some amber tones. Roasty and caramel aromas, along with some herbal aroma. Medium body and low carbonation. Taste is sweet, caramel and herbal, really smooth and easy to drink. Good sweet average finish. Really enjoyable. Maybe the atmosphere of the pub boosted my rating for this beer, but this is also part of the beer experience.
Tasted @U Fleku in 2012, several years afte the first time, and my impression this time is a watered down version of the one i remember.

Almost black pour. There are highlights of ruby in there, but otherwise dark. Big light tan head that slowly falls and leaves plenty of lacing behind. Malty aroma with hints of fig. Taste is slightly roasty, mostly malty. Nice clean finish. A little sweet. Pretty good.

Mörk, nästan svart, kropp med ett vitt skum. Till min förvåning doftar den ytterst litet, då mest av körsbär faktiskt. Smakupplevelsen är bättre, med stor fruktighet, mjukhet och lite choklad och vanilj.

Draft at the brewpub, summer 2011.  The mugs flow freely here, and with good reason.  The beer is damn solid.  A dark and cloudy, chocolate mahogany body shows just a glint of crimson at the edges when its held to the light.  A thick and spongy head sits like a khaki pillow, leaving tall, looping arches and trailing spots of lace on the glass walls.  The nose suggests of exceedingly fresh rising pumpernickel bread and younger sweet, dark dough.  Rich caramel sugars are present, but not at all heavy.  Coffee and cocoa roast lend a soft edge, while a very light egginess and twangy yeast end things on a clean note.  Flavors follow suit, nice and caramelly up front, with softly toasted dark bread notes.  I get a hint of yeasty Hawaiian sweet rolls as well.  Cocoa and mocha roast lend ample robust flavoring.  Its again kind of eggy and slightly acidic on the finish.  The palate is smooth and easy, showing a moderate, creamy body with fine, cleaning carbonation that comes through on the finish.  Damn good beer.  I could drink it all day.

19/11 Draught at the brewpub. It poured very dark body with brownish head. Sourish hop, caramel and coffee malt aroma. Light flavor, sweetish caramel and toffee are dominating, but coffee is present and get its time toward the finish, which is bitter (coffee) and slightly herbal. Thinner to medium body. Some kind of hybrid between dunkel and schwarzbier. Not bad, but definitely nowhere near the top and, as of so high rates here I expected much more. I wasnt really feeling so good that day, so it also might affect my opinion, but doubt it did so in larger scale.
Very dark brown with a medium tan head. malty with fruity notes. malt, bitterness and some sweetness. Medium body with a long, malty finish.
på flaske fra U Fleku - mulig det var noe galt med den, for den var fryktelig sur - noe den ikke skal være

Draft at U Fleku in Prague. Dark brown creamy body and a off-white creamy head. Nice malt aroma of rye, caramel, brown sugar, figs, vanilla. Rather sweet flavor and nearly none bitterness. Creamy texture and low carbonation.
Not the best dark beer in the world but definitely worth seeking out if youre in Prague. Roasted malt, a little coffee and chocolate. Rich mouthfeel.
Had at the brewpub in 2008. Dark with a beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, some caramel. Taste is sweet, a bit herbal, roasted malts.
Had it in the U Fleku tavern in Praha.  Small, thin head... crisp rye bread aromas and flavor.  Nice but not spectacular.

(draught) pours a dark brownish-black colour with a frothy beige head. very subdued aroma of brown sugar, treebark and herbal hops. flavour is coffee, toasted malts and dark berries with a slightly tart finish. body is a little thin, with average carbonation.

Thanks to E & E for the bottle. Very dark brown, like black at the glass, with a way to big head. Sticks nice, holds nice. Malty, slightly hopped, red fruits. At the taste a low sourness gets trough, nothing overwhelming, but this bottle is to be tasted today cause the expiring date. So maybe not totally what its supposed to be. Some chocolate gets trough, ok roasted. A bit watery, not totally what I hoped for, but drinkeable.
Tap @ U Fleku, Prague. Pours dark brown with a tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, caramel. Taste is roasted malt, chocolate. Medium body, soft carbonation. 010811

Huge, huge thanks to HJJH for getting this 1L growler out my way. Big surprise that they filled growlers of. Thought this was a DONG Id have to wait awhile to try. Currently the #1 Euro Dark Lager. Served in a Hill Farmstead long-stem tulip.

Pours a dark brown with a light tan head and a bit of lacing. Thin collar. The nose brings a slight amount of roast as well as some mild hops and a slight acidic cherry character. The flavor is mostly malty with a bit of roast and some noticeable Continental hops. A bit of cherry there as well. Light body and slight acidity. Not bad at all, but not quite as good as the Moonlight dark lagers that Ive come across. Interesting flavor and profile, though it doesnt quite measure up.

Serving type: growler

Chocolate malty aroma. Pitch black with white head. Mainly chocolate roasted malts taste
Medium carbonation. Easy to drink without having too much water.. Nice beer.
My great friend Josipa bring this beer from Czech in bottle of 0,7 L ... it is very bad dark beer ..i like black beers but this is very caramel and easy for drink .. nothing special ..

Tap at U Fleku. Dark brown pour with good chocolate malt presence on the nose and tongue. Pretty typical for Czech dark beer, and not all that impressive. I imagine the numbers are a bit inflated because of the hype over U Fleku itself. Still, solid.

On tap at brewpub U Fleků in Prague (0.4l). Dark brown color, big beige fluffy head. Its rater malty, some carbonation. A strong roasted malty taste, creamy texture. Not much bitterness in there. I can understand why people call this the best Czech dark beer, I agree! The atmosphere in the pub was slightly annoying, however :)

Mild malziger Antrunk, nicht sehr aromatisch. Das Malz weitet sich noch etwas aus, bleibt aber übersichtlich. Herb ab dem Mittelteil, auch dieser ist eher mild. Leicht wässrig, zum Ende wenig röstig, in gleichem Maße süß. 12/10/9/9//9

The best dark czech lager...one of the great underappreciated styles of the world. Have to drink it at the microbrewpub....oldest in the world, 510 years of continuous operation. The wandering tuba and accordian top off the experience. Drank at U Fleku in 2009 on Europe Tour right after Oktoberfest.
Dark brown / black with a creamy head. Dark roasted malt aroma and flavour. Finish is very dry and light bitterness.

Nagyon sötétbarna, szinte fekete színe van, habja világosbarna és kissé krémes, sokáig megül sörünk tetején. Illata pörkölt malátás és karamellásan cukros. Ízében is ezek a meghatározó elemek, de egy nagyon kevés medvecukor is felbukkan, keserű csoki és leheletnyi kávé társaságában. Meg nem is tudom, van valami múltidéző íze ennek a nagy hagyományokra visszatekintő sörnek. Közepesen testes, finoman száraz és szénsavas, jó sokáig el lehetne ezt kortyolgatni, csak bírjuk pénztárcával.

Dark brown.  Thick head.  Toasty, lightly bready aroma.  Worty, sugar coffee sweetness.  Quite soft.  Finishes with a bit of sweetness.  A bit too sweet to be moreish.  One of my mugs had some butter as well, which was annoying.
one of best ive ever tasted. very rich taste and has a great colour. smooth. enjoyed drinking

Bottle. Dark brown colored brew. Toasted aroma. The flavor had an unpleasant sourness which slowly faded when it became warmed up. It was a bit malty, toasted and some coffee tones. I think this bottle wasnt good anymore, 1 month past its due date. Going for a re-rate hopefully.

On tap at brewpub (can you get it anywhere else?).  Dark brown with medium head.  Chocolatey roasted aroma.  Malty flavor again with slightly sweet, slightly tangy nutty flavor.  Seemed just about perfect in the setting and easy to keep drinking as long as they bring them out, but dont know if I would seek this out elsewhere.
scura buona schiuma buona persitenza noso tostato lieve cioccolato delicato in bocca morbida fresca note tostate delicate amaro medio nocciola finale di liquirizia

Draught at the brewpub. Aromas of dark chocolate, cream, and cola. Sweet and creamy flavor with a slightly tangy aspect of berries. Roasty finish with a bit of coffee. More chocolate comes out as it warms--served too cold. Very drinkable and smooth, though not as special as some might lead one to believe. Had about 5 better tmavy in 5 days in Prague.

~Bready chocolate aroma, some diacetyl, malty, no hops.
~Pours black with brownish tints. Small, lasting light brown head.
~Light roasty malt flavor, slight astringency, light chocolate and bread.
~Med-full bodied, med CO2, balanced finish with light roastiness.
~Great session brew. Smooth and easy to drink!

On tap at U Fleku on 8th July 2010. Almost black with a thick lowering pale brown foamhead. Malty with quite a bitter kick. Zingy mouthfeel and very thirstquenching. Just the slightest hint of saltiness on the tongue. I liked it.

Looks a treat very dark red/brown white big creamy white head, nice aroma of burnt malt & fruit.  Body is class, nice & creamy with gentle carbonation, & those nice soft flavours of fruit, dark malt, milky coffee & chocolate.  A great dark Czech beer & good fun place

On tap at U Fleku. Great beer there. The color was very dark with a nice white head. A perfect balance (in taste and aroma) of chocolate and coffee. Tastes sweet. The carbonation was soft.

One very great beer me and my girlfriend really enjoyed on our trip to Czech Republic! The evening was hot (around 28 Celsius) and that beer was very refreshing!

A must try for everyone going into Czech Republic!

It really doesnt get any better than this. Beautiful brown beer with ruby highlights. It was a little lighter than I expected. Aroma of sweet malt, baked bread, grass. Flavors of caramel, toffee, grain. Smooth, clean finish. This is all from memory from way back, but I still dream about this beer and those two guys walking around with a tuba and an accordion singing songs!

Bottle: mostly toasted malt, very much like a toasted almost burnt bread, some cooked butter, weak mocca notes, weak chocolate notes, weak nutty notes and weak toffee notes but again its mainly a liquid toast, quite tasty one.

Tap @ U Fleku, Prague. Pours dark brown with a creamy lasting beige head and lacings. Nose is dark malts, caramel, toffee and fruit. Smooth and full bodied. Sweet flavor with lots of chewy caramel and toffee. Nice and quaffable even at 10.00 in the morning!
Draught (U Fleku, Prague) - Dark brown with red tinges and a foamy head. Malty aroma with caramel and dried fruits. Sweet and fruity taste with malt and hints of Dundee cake. Fairly enjoyable.

From [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Fleku. A thick, yellowish cream head upon a ruddy hued, dark brown colored body with a certain clarity. Fresh, chocolate-scented with tones of mild coffee, cocoa, toffee and toasted, dark bread. Taste has a fine dryness with a delicate, chocolatey malt profile. Faint caramel, bread, and a crisp fruitiness underneath. Rich and flavorfull, yet very refreshing and extremely easy to drink. Yummie!

on tap at U Fleku, nice dark ruby/black color with lovely tan head. Aroma of honey, coffe and caramel which carried over well to the flavor. I found it quite light for a dark beer and it was very easy to drink, can get quite addictive, good thing beer is cheap in Prague. Good Dunkel

UPDATED: DEC 14, 2011 draft at the brewery. dense dark unfiltered brown body with a dark tan head, creamy, finely-bubbled and beautiful. crisp coffee cake and sharp and intensely deep toasted malt in the nose.  little bit of cola, snappy toffee malt, toasty, crisp, chewy, very rich.  caramelized raisins, crunchy cereals, small bit of char and smoke... mildly dry bite of roast... just wonderful throughout.
Draught at the brewpub. thick beige head. very dark in color, sweet taste, coffee. very refreshing an soft, easy to drink.

Draught at the brewpub. Poured a murky dark red/black body with a stable medium sized off white foam, thick and lovely. The nose isnt all that complex, grainy with notes of coffee. Light watery sweetish grainy taste, a bit roasty, even some yeasty notes. Ok, refreshing, but hardly all that impressive and Ive had better. Now that Ive had the beer and had a picture taken with the plaque saying that the best footie club in the universe and beyond Hajduk Split was founded there I dont see much reason to return there unless someone elses paying.

UPDATED: NOV 15, 2009 What a wonderful beer! That place was magic.. The musicians, the waiters, the sausages.. I took 3-4 pints of flekovsky and I can say for sure, that it was the most amazing beer Ive ever drunk. The Price: 69 Czech crowns for 500ml, that is 2,70.
Expensive for Praha, cheap for its taste.
0,4l from tap. Pitch black color with a long lasting brown head. Malty aroma with a semi-bitter flavor containing some malts and fruits. Very enjoyable.

Draught. Low but lasting off-white creamy head. Pitch black body. Pitch black body. Mild and sweet coffee aroma. Sweet coffee roasted malt flavor with little hops bitterness. Watery sweet and boring. Low carbonation, short aftertaste.
Tap.3x40cl Nice and just right for the place, soft and just plecent. good hop for a beer in Prague.

Hazy dark brown with a very pretty off-white head. Aroma of toffee, with some licorice and a hint of DMS. Sweet toffee flavour, with a slightly roasty finish. Violently over-carbonated. The 59 Korona I paid is quite precisely the price of two Urquells at any other pub in the tourist area of Prague...

Black colored with huge beige head. Sweet and caramelly aroma with thin roastiness, nothing special. Thin to medium bodied. Flavor is more roasted with caramel still dominating, aftertaste dries slightly.
draught at the brewpub. Deep dark brown colour, beige head. Malty nose. Malty, flavours of roasetd malt and caramel, hints of chocolate and coffee with a shy fruity touch (prunes).
tanned head, dark brown color, almost black. Cloudy. Smooth roasted malts aroma, plums, chocolate. Soft and smooth palate. Flavor is sour ath the start. Coffee, chocolate, rye. Very well balanced.

On tap at the U Fleku in Praque.
Colour is nearly as Coca Cola, with a nice frothy big tan head. Aroma is sweet malts. Feels soft in the mouth, taste is dark fruits with a good balance between the sweet/bitter. One of my all time best Dunkel.

on tap at the brewery, pours dark brown, tall off white head.  Sweet carmel malt and buttery popcorn aroma with a light smokyness.  Roasted malt, dark candy sugar, and a carmel sweetness ends with a lingering light smoke flavor.  Great beer.

UPDATED: JAN 28, 2009 At the brewery tap in Prague when I visited in June last year. Comments recorded contemporaneously. A dark brown beer with a fluffy off white head. (I was surprised to discover it is a dunkel). Sweet caramel toasted malt aroma with hints of mocha. Smooth mouthfeel with similar flavours to the nose. Sweetish finish. Highly sessionable which I guess is the point at this rather touristy brewpub. The waiters will be replacing your beer as soon as you have have drunk it.

Draught at U Fleku, Prague. Pours a dark brown with dense beige head. Sweet dark malt aroma with chocolate and toffee notes. Flavour of dark malt, roasted malt, chocolate and coffee. Sweet, well balanced finish.

Sep 11, 2007  
On tap at U Fleku. Cola brown with large fomay head. Chocolate taste, quite sweet and sugary. Really crisp, refreshing and very smooth. Served at a very cool temperature in the middle of a zoo - full of tourists and an oompah loompah band. Got my drink and moved on to greener pastures...

On tap @ U Fleku. Dark brown to black beer, creamy beige head. Aroma of dark malts, some sweetness and a hint of coffee. Flavour is very soft, lightly sweet, malty, some chocolate, coffee, slightly bitter. Very well balanced and rather fullbodied. Very nice!

Draught at U Fleku brewpub (Prague).
Beautiful intense black color with persistent head of strain nut. Roast, singed aroma much pleasant with notes of malt and toasted cereals. Stinging slightly taste of good duration.

At U Fleku Prague, on draught. A little hazy black colored beer, with a beige head. The aroma of dark caramel, with dark fruits. The taste of caramel met raisins and a little chocolate. A soft taste. It has a good bitter sweet aftertaste.
@ U Fleku, Prague. Deep dark pour with roasty aroma. Smooth tasting. Nothing elaborate or complicated. Seemed more of a porter or schwarzbiier. Medium bodied. Some residual sweetness. Decent

UPDATED: JAN 18, 2009 On tap at U Fleku. A dark brown/black brew, it has an aroma of coffee and woodshavings (for some reason!) and a medium body which has sweetness, roast, chocolate and a hint of bitterness. A well made beer,

Draught at U Fleku brewpub. Hazy dark brown with large beige long  lasting head. Butter aroma with roasted malt and caramel. Sweet flavor with mild fruity, caramel, butter and roasted malt notes. Ends sweet.

Draught at U Fleků. Pours dark brown with a large tan head. Weak nose of malt with roasted notes. Mild malt flavour with coffee notes. Light to medium bodied. Ends up more dry. Served too cold. A bit too thin for my taste, but 1 point for an interesting history.

(6/24/08) Draught at the brewpub in Prague. Very dark brown color with a rather big rocky beige head. Aroma of toasted malt, hints of coffee an caramel. A sweet malty, quite rich flavor, with toastiness, some light roasted hints, caramel, coffee notes, light sugariness and a sweetish finish with a very mild spicy hint. Medium-bodied. Very nice.

(Draught at U Fleku brewpub, Prague, 19 July 2008) Very dark brown colour with firm, creamy, pale brown head. Malty nose with chocolate, brown sugar and slightly citric hop notes. Malty taste with notes of chocolate, coffee and citrussy hops in a fairly short and not very bitter finish. Well, this certainly is a serious tourist trap, but the beer is good so it has to be done. Nice one.

Tap @ Pivovar U Fleku, Prague.
Tourist trap you say? Well, I most certainly agree...
Pours deep, dark black with a great, creamy, light-beige head. Aroma is mildly roasted, some chocolate and a hint of butter. Light mouthfeel, frankly a bit thin. Flavour is soft and well-balanced. Finely roasted malts with dark chocolate and light coffee notes. Good, but too thin.
From tap at the brewpub. Deep dark brown... Deep blackcurrent roast ... loads of toffee well balanced ... very tasty toffee and coffeee and a litgtle sweetness ... drying in linger

From tap at the brewpub. Pours dark and hazy brown with a slowly collapsing tan head. Aroma is mild butterish and roasted malt. Flavour holds the same and leads into a mild bitterness into the finish. Ends medium dry.

Draught. Deep rubyish brown colour with big beigeish brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, some chocolateish notes as well as toffee. Flavour is quite much the same in a good balance. Big palate. Good beer, but crappy place...

Draught at Pilsner Urquell, Düsseldorf. Dark brown coloured. Malty and bready aroma. Quite roasty. Some sweet toffee notes as well. Rather typical of the style, but above average quality. Well balanced and not too swet.
Tap at U Fleku. Dark hazy color. Taste was a bit sweet with som roasty notes and a finish filled with chocolat and caramel.

Tap at the Fleku. What a huge and atmospheric pub. I suppose you are either grinning at the good time atmosphere or feeling a little awkward and shy. We loved it. Everyone was smiling and friendly. The waiters are friendly and honest, and people are mainly relaxed and enjoying themselves, though you can spot those who feel out of place - they look a little stiff and embarrassed. The beer is black and malty sweet. Quite delicious. Fresh and easy drinking. Its soon gone, and then its time for another one, and then its time for the bitter Becherovka liquor to wash it all down. A great experience!

Huge beige head, black body. Sweet aroma of toffe and roasted malt. In the flavour is some coffe, roasted malt and some sweetnes, good carbonation. Good but not an exciting one, avarge...I expected more about that famous beer...
This is from beer house where Hajduk was founded and as a fan of Dinamo I should avoid it. Anyway I heared that they had good beer and it is great no matter of football :))

En fût. Pinte dégustée directement à la brasserie. Arôme: Odeur de céréales grillées avec une pointe de mélasse. Apparence: La couleur est noire. Présence dun large col beige mousseux et dune large dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de café et de chocolat. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement minérale. Légère présence de café en arrière goût. (Rating #1518)

Back from a Czech Republic pub-crawl this is part of my express ratings for the typical Světlý 11°- (Czech light Pils), Světlý 12°+ (Czech Pils), Polotmavý (Czech Amber Lagers) and Tmavý (Czech Black Lagers).  Non-typical beers will receive personalized descriptions after the express ratings.-------- />
How: Tap at brewpub (Pivovar U Fleku, Prague) 
The look: Almost black body with a large tan head.
To me a typical Czech Tmavé (Czech Black Lager) is: Dark malts and barely any roastiness sensation.  Some dark fruits flavours (raisins with a little figs, dates and prunes) wrapped in smooth dark caramel (borderline toffee) and a subtle chocolate note.  A bit bready.  Moderately sweet without much hops presence and only a mild bitterness (voluntary unbalanced it seems).  Very smooth body, like a watery cream.
This one: Pretty much as above.  Typical example of a style.  Overall slightly above average quality-wise.

Draught, U Fleku/Praha.

Head is initially average sized, frothy, light brown, mostly lasting.
Body is dark brown to black.

Aroma is moderately malty (toasted grain, molasses, chocolate milk), with a note of vanilla.

Flavor is moderately to heavily sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter.
Finish is lightly to moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly to moderately bitter.

Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation.

Fun atmosphere (except the waiter who kept bugging people to take the shots of apple schnapps or whatever the heck it was...leave me alone!) with the accordian guy and lots of singing from the guests.  The beer is just ok, kind of boring.

Draught at U Fleku.   Dark hazy brown with a beige head.   Sweet roasty and bready aroma.   The flavor is a little sweet, has some faint hops, and a light roast.   The carbonation is a little too high.   Easy to drink overall and pretty pleasant, but not quite as good as the other dunkels in Pragues brewpubs.

Alla spina da U Fleku (naturalmente!), a parte laroma abbastanza anonimo lho trovata eccezionale, un sapore raffinato ma allo stesso tempo beverino ed invitante. Il fatto che ne abbia bevuti tre litri è abbastanza indicativo...

Draft @ U Fleku, obviously. Comes out on a massive tray from which the waiter grabs a number of at a time and slams down on any empty beer coaster.  Massive dense beige head, near opaque  with slight brownish-red tinge, nose wonderfully rich and sweet, doughy and lightly smoky, somewhat reminded me of grape jelly, hops are very faint and grassy, beer finishes crisp and clean on the palate, ready for more.  A special treat, even if the surrounding environment is more a facsimile of a Czech pivnice than the true thing.
Its a great, if touristy and overpriced, beer hall in Praha. Very dark and a little thick maltiness. Light carbonation and not much on the nose but the experience made the beer a little better.

UPDATED: NOV 3, 2007 Arrives in glass mug (was it dimpled?). Watery appearance, but excellent hue of brown. Rather light bodied and thin, and high in maltiness. There is something special about it though. Really tastes fresh and has no off-notes. Just a good straightforward dunkel.

Draught. Dark brown-black with red hues and a huge frothy brownish head. Sweet malt nose, shallow but pleasant. Flavor is sweet with some coffee and chocolate notes. Slightly thin but heavy carbonation gives it a more robust character.

On tap at U Fleku. Cola brown with large fomay head. Chocolate taste, quite sweet and sugary. Really crisp, refreshing and very smooth. Served at a very cool temperature in the middle of a zoo - full of tourists and an oompah loompah band. Got my drink and moved on to greener pastures...

A terrible brew (the only beer I didnt finish out of 50 beers I had in the Czech Republic) - Hazy almost black body, long lasting creamy light brown head; Very little very simple plain malt aroma; Acidy broken body with a sharp carbonation; Lemon fruity acidy finish, 1-dimensional dark roasted malt aroma. This beer is just as unpleasant as the place that serves it.

UPDATED: JUN 3, 2008 A wonderful brew. Served with gusto and repitition at the source in Praha!  A dark slate black/brown  in the mug.  Frothy rolling head. Poured expertly by Pavel and Heinrik.  They gave me lessons.  Body is lasting but not overpowering. Goes down easy. and frequent. A jewel of Prague.  Nose was wiped out by Tubas and accordians...not to mention all the smoke.
This beer is great for those that like the dark beer taste without the full body of a "chewy" dark beer.  Notes of roasted coffee, carmel, and nuts.

Draught at U Fleku - 2 times, monday and the following wednesday, and they were very different - 1. time: good -  Dark almost black - light brown head. Dry, roasted, bread, chokolate. A bit simpel & boring.. 2. time: boring !! - No carbonation, too cold, and a lot lighter in every way.

Draught at U Fleku, Praha.
Dark brown coloured, medium sized pale brown head, hoppy nose. The aroma is malty and hoppy with too sweet caramel and toffee notes. Bitterish and slight vinager finish. Except the atmosphere this place is very expencive and not worth of stoping.

Draught at the brewpubDark brown color; big thick head. Sweet aroma, caramel, malt, a touch of vanilla. Light body structure, and poor flavor that doesnt match the aroma; dry, with some roasted malt and caramel. At the end there is a light roasted malt line and light hop. Refreshing but nothing special.

Quite sour (vinegar) aroma. Very creamy, stiff, off-white head. Nearly black color. Light malty, light sourly. Light fruitiness and very light roastiness. Light bitter finish with roastiness. Boring, sourly, disappointing.

On tap at U Fleku, Prague, Filtered, 500ml. Black beer with tan head. Ok this is tourist hell in here, although visiting early doors makes it a pleasant place to be, the biggest problem is pushy waiters and a smiling winking accordian player. But settling down on the hard wooden benches with beer stained tables everything seemed fine. The beer is a dark flavoursome thing of beauty, like a sweet stout with a sweet bitter flavour, full of chocolate malts and a deep lying blackcurrant fruitiness. We spent some times with Czechs up from the country and they were determined to have a good time in their Capitol city, we joined them in a few of these full bodied beersand had a thoroughly good time.
The atmosphere of U Fleku certainly helped, but this dark beer was quite enjoyable in its own right.

Sort-brun øl med klar frugt duft.

Smag af frugt ?

Tør og let gæret efter smag

Man forventer en brændt smag - men den er der overhovedet ikke.

Mystisk øl - opvaskevand ???
Black color, under a lamb dark brown, full foamy head, very nice interesting one!,..  very good balance of,..chocolate, coffee, resin, licorice and smood creamy foam.

Draught @ U Fleku. Nice appearance. Thin boidied with a little roast, some caramel and uncomplementary sharpness. Despite what some people might say I didnt find it worth braving the tourist trap of U Fleku for this.
UPDATED: FEB 26, 2007 Dark amber, nice offwhite head. Toffe aroma, malty with vanilla and caramel. Malty flavor, vanilla and toffee comes back, somewhat netallic finish.

Draught from the souce.  Intense aroma, roastiness, hops, coffee, chocolate.  Opaque pitch with a little brown around the edges.  Creamy, foamy, rich, lacing tan head.  Utterly gorgeous.  Taste is intensely roast and choclatey, hoppy and malty with hints of toffee and sweetness.  Bodys a little light, but with a crisp, unusually coating hoppy finish, medium dry.  Odins Raven, this is good.  Would want to down five or six of these.

UPDATED: DEC 2, 2006 Even though this place is a tourist trap it is worth putting up with the attempt to rip you off by putting unwanted liquour in front of you to taste this dark brew with a big tan head.  Nose of malt, and good all the way down. You could down a bunch of these in a hurry.

Tap @ Brewpub. Deep woody brown with huge head, strong stiff crown. Woody, some caramel character, some light mineral feel which was incoherent with beer itself. Medium bodied with lighter roasty, woody character. Not as complex as I wished for. Slightly dry.
(Tap) Excellent beer, by far the best I had in Prague. Pours brown/black with offwhite head. Sweet malty flavors. Full taste, but lacks some of the body I expected. Other then that it was great.

[on tap at U Fleku (duh)]
Opaque, cloudy blackish-brown with almost a rocky beige top that dries and clings to the glass.  Powdery dark malt aroma with nice fresh Saaz--perhaps a bit weak, but even and very pleasant.  Candy caramel liquorice, sweet, moderate Saaz, moderate bitterness, a little chalky from dark malt like Kostritzer = flavour.  Nice, smooth finish with moderate carbonation and a medium to light body.
Very sweet and dark, like a dark Vienna, maybe. But it was not a deal from the opther world.

On tap at U Fleku.  Very dark bron with thick beige head. Slightly sour aroma. Dark malts are slightly charcoaly but theres some toffee. Some creaminess in the mouth. I quite like this even though the waiters are slightly pushy. Good dark lager, plenty of subtle dark malt flavours with a slightly sour/dry finish. Bit of liquorice, just lacks the body

Medium, brown creamy head over dark red almost opaque black hazy body. Sweet toffee/licorice aroma with roasty notes. Deep, sweet, complex taste of licorice and spiec with some acidity in the aftertaste. Excellent!

U Fleku is a must visit if youre in Prague, just make sure not to eat the bread and turn down any extra food or drinks they offer you.  When we got to our table, before we ordered anything, our waiter brought us two beers.  They were quite good, a nice dark beer in a region famous for its lighter styles.  Very light for a dark beer, goes down easy, slightly smokey but never sluggish, a perfect accompaniement to Prague cuisine.  Even though its a tourist trap, hit up U Fleku and down a couple of these beers.

UPDATED: JUL 2, 2008 Draught at U Fleku in May 2006.

Dark brown color, big creamy beige lasting head. Butterscotch and burnt scent. A bit burnt taste. Lots of butterscotch in the taste as well. Medium mouthfeel, medium bitterness. Fruity aftertaste.
I had 5 on the row in there, its hard to stop drinking this wonderful beer!

Also tried it on bottle brought back from the brewery, it was not at all as sweet and nice as it is at the brwery, even though I only bought it 21 days before drinking the bottle. Still, the drink at the brewery on draught is awesome, just not a good idea to buy it and bring it back home...
Rating from May 2005:

Its quite expensive at this classic (the worlds oldest) brew pub, and a real "tourist trap" indeed. But the beer has a special character to it and its still a must to go to the place to try it out. A bit spicy, quite dark brew.
Ar: 8 Ap: 4 Fl: 8 Pa: 4 Ov: 16Rerate(Draught at U Fleku on June 30, 2008Dark brown to black color, fluffy light brown head. Spicy and sweet taste, rather refreshing. Smooth mouthfeel, medium bitterness. Cheeze hoppy scent.7/4/8/4/15=3.8
The best beer I had in Prague - nothing else was even close.  U Flekus beer (they only brew one) is thick and rich and sweet and utterly delicious.  Chocolate, maybe a touch of roast.  Lovely stuff.

Pours very dark brown close to black with a tall brown head that looks like it was poured from a nitro tap with its smoothness and sturdiness. Nice light roast flowing to a creamy smooth texture to the beer. Light notes of chocolate and bread show in the malts with a light spiciness to the hops in the finish.
Dark brown colour, dense finger high head. The aroma was roasted malt with a brief touch of smoke. Really roasty flavour of malt, dark chocolate, coffee and toffee.

One of the mosty hyped rare beers one can try, I found it fine as a session Dunkel, somewhat light in body like Porters as mentioned. Bready and sweet flavor notes, collapsing head, ale-like fruit aroma notes, fine stuff to chase with a Becherovka. All Czech waiters should be shot.

UPDATED: MAY 30, 2008 On tap at the brewpub in 2005:

The Lure:Tart fruitiness is easily predicted, as berries sprouting from wet earth attempt a show of wealth. Molasses seep in, but forget most of their richness. Head is large at first, but diminishes quickly.

The Festivities:Spicy roastiness and fruity vanilla arent helped into fulfillment by the light and quenching body. Nagging sourness sits at the forefront, while mild caramel undermines the quiet finish. Burnt bread comes sporadically, but cant stick because of the lack of malty rotundity. 3.2/5

Transcendence:An intriguing rock formation.

On tap at the brewpub in 2008:
No hint of tartness this time around, just a nice chocolate bread in a round body conveying subtle fruitiness and cozy malt flavors. Much better than the first time around. 3.5/5

Opaque brown color like a porter, with a bubbly brown head.  Sweet flavors of licorice, burnt caramel, and some spice in front, but ends awkwardly bready.  Very good overall, but doesnt live up to the hype.

UPDATED: JUL 1, 2009 Bottle. Dark brown colour, a little muddy looking. Sourish aroma. Smooth liquorice flavour. Aftertaste is a little bready. IIRC, this is a lot better fresh from the tap.

Draught at the brewpub. Black colour. Good stable light brown head. The flavour is OK roasted. Mildly caramelly, quite nice. Thin but nice. 7 3 7 3 17

(Draught at pivovar U Fleku, Prague.)
Almost black with a thick beige head. Hoppy nose with some sweetness. Sweet caramelly flavour with roasted hints. Somewhat chewy mouthfeel. Medium bitterness. Medium bodied.
Coffee taste in the finish.

Right from the tap in the tourists trap called U Fleků: very dark amber coloured, almost as black as the furniture in the old beer-hall, firm, lasting brown foamy head,malty nose with a sourish tinge from far behind, taste: roasted malts, a tinge of sweetness only in the beginning, dry malty lasting finish with a shy bitterness. O.K., but this beer is exclusively brewed for bloody tourists, only a foolish czech beer-enthusiast would pay for less than 0,5 l twice as much as in an excellent but normal Prague pub....

Draught at U Fleku (with dortmunder). Served too cold. Very dark brown, nearly black colour - impenetrable for light. Moderate creamy tan head. Lovely aroma of leather and oak, dark chocolate and liquorice. Flavour is malty and moderately roasty, notes of dark chocolate and coffee. Never mind the inflated prices (by Czech standards), this beer is a must (at least once). And the liqueur we were forced to buy (which I drank AFTER the beer) actually tasted not-too-bad.

UPDATED: MAR 25, 2005 Draft at Pilsner Urquell Brauereiausschank in Düsseldorf. Black colour. Big, lasting, foamy head with a good lace. Strong malty, caramelly aroma with hints of cinnamon.Roastmalty, spicy taste, with some caramel and cinnamon notes. Sweet and malty in the beginning, ending in a spicy, slightly bitter finish. Creamy texture. Very nice. Re-rate: Sampled at U Fleku. Good thing is, now I believe that the stuff in Dusseldorf is authentic. Bad thing is, they serve it too cold in Prague, better to have it in Dusseldorf+U Fleku sucks totally. Due to the wrong temperature I wont change my rating, but it would have been 0.1-0.2 points lower. Still, a hell of a Dunkel.

Quite a good porter, which is to be expected of a beer brewed since 1499.  A bit smoky, with coffee overtones, nice grayish/white head, deep brown (almost black) body.  If youre in Prague, the beer is worth the trip, although its expensive (50 crowns or $2 per 0.4 litres) by Czech standards.  *)
i can´t believe it took me this long to actually make it to the brewery. anyway, molasses colour, molasses aroma. a little sticky but pretty drinkable. hint of black banana and cocoa powder. not bad

Creamy, light brown head - mostly diminsihing.  Good lace.  Black body.  Toasted and coffee aroma.  Lightly sweet, moderately bitter initial flavour.  Lightly bitter (long) finish.  Medium body.  Soft carbonation.

UPDATED: JUL 1, 2004 Thats the best beer I ever had! Creamy head even after few minutes (the best head Ive ever seen), very dark but not too strong, it reminds me od Tomislav beer (the best in Croatia), just perfect!  Worth every Czech crown (price is cca. 4 USD for a mug, very expensive regarding czech standard).

Having visited Fleku 5 times now, I totally agree with the other posters that it's one large money-making exercise.  The waiters literally pour the shot glasses of spirit into your mouth, and it can get (uncomfortably) full of coachparties listening to the cheesy one-man oompah band.  However, if you catch it right, it's a great experience.  The beer is overpriced, even for Praha, but is worth having at least once.  A dark brown/black brew, it has an aroma of coffee and woodshavings (for some reason!) and a medium body which has sweetness, roast, chocolate and a hint of bitterness.  A well made beer, I'm surprised it's so good given the conveyorbelt attitude of the place.  (drunk on draught in the pub)

Tried in the one and only, much-hyped U Fleku pub, Nove Mesto, Prague. A rather overwhelming experience generally, which made concentrating on the beer rather difficult. The waiters are all over you like a rash, trying force 'traditional' liquers down your neck, along with large glasses of the black stuff. Certainly a dark and sweet affair (the beer) - with unusual sausage notes. Unpleasant aroma, cheesy and doggy. Persistent topping of froth. This was nice and fairly light, but it seemed too much like conveyor belt beer, which was in keeping with the attitude of the waiters!

Visited the pub in 1989, and every time since when I am in Prague, I always go and visit this pub. The beer has a big creamy head, and the dark colour is perfect. The taste has hints of cocoa. As other have noted, the serving staff is to busy on making profit.

I had this beer in a room with the greatest atmosphere ever. This pub is truly classic and fantastic. You get to drink so much in a very short period of time. This means that at eleven, when the pub closes you're very drunk and ready to conquer the Golden City of Prague. It is a bit thin, but that is ok. because it lets you drink large amounts of this brew. A true Classic!!!!

Draft at U Fleku: Pours a beautiful dark brown with a hint of rust at the edges. . . large rocky head.  Let me take some time at this point to note that you don't ever have to place an order for this beer, frequently there will be a server wander through the room with a dozen brews and if you need filling up, one will be set on your table and tick made on your bill. . . what great service. . . anyway, a light wooden aroma with some toast and nuts puts me in a good mood as soon as I get this mid-day treat.  Deeply roasted flavour with a good taste of alcohol, burnt toast, and ripe fruit.  Smooth clean palate only thing I would only add to the slightly one dimensional aroma. . .

This beer was actually a huge dissapointment to me - U Fleku brewery managed somehow to hype it high and their marketing does amazing miracles in promoting its fame, especially abroad Czechia... however, the beer is neither good at all nor typical representative of Czech beers. As I am a pilsener/lager fan I may be a bit biased when rating dunkel beer but this one is bellow average even in its own category. Chunky consistence with strange cocoa/cofee taste made me doubt it is beer at all.
BTW, as madsberg here correctly noted, the staff of the pub is focused solely on the profit and cares little about customer satisfaction and friendly mood - the prices are inflated compared to other places in Prague's centre and waiters will ignore your wishes and try to sell you as much liquer (even rather than their beer - probably because of profit margin) as possible.

UPDATED: JUL 30, 2003 The setting helps you to rate this beer. If you are in Prague the beer is going to taste better simply due to osmosis. Dark brown with fresh creamy head. Not a lot of hop but excellent balance. My only complaints about this beer was that my wife was with me the day we visited. Bad organisstion on my part.
user_location: Potts Point, New South Wales, AUSTRALIA

text: Draught: Dark brown coloured. Huge brownish head. Lasting. Chocolate and cocoa in the nose. Very smooth flavoured with notes of cocoa. Lightly watery. Im not owerly thrilled by the concept of U Fleko. The way the waiters push you by constantly trying to sell more beer is a little too much for me. The beer is good though and absolutely worth a visit.

Served(a little too cold) of course at U Fleku, Prague. Deep dark brown color. Fresh in the texture though roasted. Fine dark head. Pleasant dark beer, I think this can be ordered again..and again..and...! This is a winner in the long run!

UPDATED: JUN 19, 2005 Has the look and aroma of a real Czech dark beer: dark bread, roasted almost smoky. A longlasting head and a quite sweet taste.
Surprisingly lively carbonation.
UPDATED: JAN 27, 2003 Very good appereance with a dark persistant foam. the flavour is a little sweet and malty, really pleasant. Incredible if drunk together with the Czech liquor, Becherovka.

After almost an hour of bus and subway rides and walking through Pragues city streets, I found the beer that I had been searching for since arriving in the Czech Republic. Wonderful deep dark brown color with a array of flavors that seemed to be more sweet and malty than bitter. Easy to drink with a medium body and a pleasing finish. Well worth the trip.

Deep dark brown on color; HUGE dark tan head; Aroma and a wonderful mix of cinnamon and wood. Sour cherry right away almost turned me off. Musky to say the least- very strange combination for the first few sips. Each time I poured a bit, the head would go CRAZY. The lace is unreal. As it warms and my tingue gets used to the beer, the tartness really mellows out. I haev to say that there was a lot going on in this beer and the fact that only two of us have tasted it is disturbing. (bottle brough to me from the Flekovsky Brewery in Prague).
Dark brown, gently roasty, full bodied, soft, relatively sweet with balanced bitterness.
